meanings.definition: In a state of constant change or fluctuation.
meanings.sent1: The weather in our city is very fluxional, always changing from sunny to rainy in a short time.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was fluxional, shifting from happiness to sadness throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The fluxional nature of the stock market kept investors on their toes.
meanings.sent4: Time is a fluxional river, never stopping or staying the same for long.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the fluxional essence of life in his ever-changing paintings.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to flow or move easily.
meanings.sent1: The fabric of the dress was so fluxional, allowing her to dance freely at the party.
meanings.sent2: The river was fluxional, smoothly flowing downstream without any obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's movements were so fluxional, like a graceful swan gliding across the stage.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were fluxional, flowing effortlessly from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The music had a fluxional rhythm that made it easy to sway along.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a continuous movement or flow.
meanings.sent1: The fluxional traffic on the highway made the commute longer than usual.
meanings.sent2: The waterfall created a fluxional cascade of water down the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter filled the park with a fluxional energy.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements were so fluxional, like a never-ending wave of grace.
meanings.sent5: The city was alive with the fluxional movement of people going about their day.
